answers.answer: I have with 3 of my pregnancies. The only time I did it was with my 1st baby. After not being able to finish the test due to puking I just gave up. I think it's a waste of time especially if you can't complete it and all of your babies are within 6-7 pound range.
I'm just careful about what I eat.
I would never. You could have no risk factors and still end up as a gestational diabetic which could cause severe harm to both you and baby if not treated promptly and correctly.

I wouldnt refuse it. The only test i refused was the one to determine if they have down syndrome or w e I felt that was silly so I refused that one. Glucose test is very important you could have no symptoms no risk factors and still have developed it. I am high risk and likley to develope diabetes it runs heavily in my family but my test was fine. Goodluck
You should call healthcare.gov and get insurance

question: Has anyone ever refused a glucose test? I have normal pregnancy and no risk factors for diabetes. All of this is out of pocket cost and honestly I'm a person who prefers little interventions and honestly I feel this is a waste of time if I have no indicators.
title: refused glucose test?
